org.apache.kafka.streams.processor

Interface TimestampExtractor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConsumerRecordTimestampExtractor, WallclockTimestampExtractor

    public interface TimestampExtractor
    An interface that allows the Kafka Streams framework to extract a timestamp from an instance of ConsumerRecord. The extracted timestamp is defined as milliseconds.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long extract(ConsumerRecord<Object,Object> record)
      Extracts a timestamp from a record.

    • Method Detail

      • extract

        long extract(ConsumerRecord<Object,Object> record)
        Extracts a timestamp from a record.

        The extracted timestamp MUST represent the milliseconds since midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC. It is important to note that this timestamp may become the message timestamp for any messages sent to changelogs updated by KTables and joins. The message timestamp is used for log retention and log rolling, so using nonsensical values may result in excessive log rolling and therefore broker performance degradation.

        Parameters:
        record - a data record
        Returns:
        the timestamp of the record
